Public Shared Function AreEquivalent (oldNode As SyntaxNode, newNode As SyntaxNode, topLevel As Boolean) As Boolean

Docs.param: If true then the nodes are equivalent if the contained nodes and tokens declaring metadata visible symbolic information are equivalent, ignoring any differences of nodes inside method bodies or initializer expressions, otherwise all nodes and tokens must be equivalent.
Docs.summary: Determines if two syntax nodes are the same, disregarding trivia differences.

Docs.param: If specified called for every child syntax node (not token) that is visited during the comparison. If it returns true the child is recursively visited, otherwise the child and its subtree is disregarded.
Docs.summary: Determines if two syntax nodes are the same, disregarding trivia differences.

public static Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTrivia ElasticCarriageReturn { get; }
.property valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTrivia ElasticCarriageReturn
Public Shared ReadOnly Property ElasticCarriageReturn As SyntaxTrivia

Docs.summary: An elastic trivia with kind EndOfLineTrivia containing a single carriage return character. Elastic trivia are used to denote trivia that was not produced by parsing source text, and are usually not preserved during formatting.

Public Shared ReadOnly Property ElasticCarriageReturnLineFeed As SyntaxTrivia

Docs.summary: An elastic trivia with kind EndOfLineTrivia containing both the carriage return and line feed characters. Elastic trivia are used to denote trivia that was not produced by parsing source text, and are usually not preserved during formatting.

.method public static hidebysig valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTrivia ElasticEndOfLine(string text) cil managed
Public Shared Function ElasticEndOfLine (text As String) As SyntaxTrivia

Docs.param: The text of the end of line. Any text can be specified here, however only carriage return and line feed characters are recognized by the parser as end of line.
Docs.summary: Creates a trivia with kind EndOfLineTrivia containing the specified text. Elastic trivia are used to denote trivia that was not produced by parsing source text, and are usually not preserved during formatting.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTrivia ElasticWhitespace (string text);

Docs.summary: Creates a trivia with kind WhitespaceTrivia containing the specified text. Elastic trivia are used to denote trivia that was not produced by parsing source text, and are usually not preserved during formatting.

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.Syntax.ExpressionSyntax GetStandaloneExpression(class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.Syntax.ExpressionSyntax expression) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the containing expression that is actually a language expression and not just typed as an ExpressionSyntax for convenience. For example, NameSyntax nodes on the right side of qualified names and member access expressions are not language expressions, yet the containing qualified names or member access expressions are indeed expressions.

Public Shared Function MissingToken (kind As SyntaxKind) As SyntaxToken

Docs.param: A syntax kind value for a token. These have the suffix Token or Keyword.
Docs.summary: Creates a missing token corresponding to syntax kind. A missing token is produced by the parser when an expected token is not found. A missing token has no text and normally has associated diagnostics.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxToken Token (Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTriviaList leading, Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.SyntaxKind kind, string text, string valueText, Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTriviaList trailing);

.method public static hidebysig valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxToken Token(valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTriviaList leading, valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.SyntaxKind kind, string text, string valueText, valuetype Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTriviaList trailing) cil managed
Public Shared Function Token (leading As SyntaxTriviaList, kind As SyntaxKind, text As String, valueText As String, trailing As SyntaxTriviaList) As SyntaxToken

Docs.param: A list of trivia immediately preceding the token.
A syntax kind value for a token. These have the suffix Token or Keyword.
The text from which this token was created (e.g. lexed).
How C# should interpret the text of this token.
A list of trivia immediately following the token.
Docs.summary:
Creates a token corresponding to syntax kind. This method gives control over token Text and ValueText.
For example, consider the text '<see cref="operator +"/>'. To create a token for the value of the operator symbol (+), one would call Token(default(SyntaxTriviaList), SyntaxKind.PlusToken, "+", "+", default(SyntaxTriviaList)).
